verses:
A psalm for David himself.  Mercy and judgment I will sing to
thee, O Lord:  I will sing,

And I will understand in the unspotted way, when thou shalt come
to me.  I walked in the innocence of my heart, in the midst of my house.

I will not set before my eyes any unjust thing:  I hated the
workers of iniquities.

The perverse heart did not cleave to me:  and the malignant, that
turned aside from me, I would not know.

The man that in private detracted his neighbour, him did I
persecute.  With him that had a proud eye, and an unsatiable heart, I
would not eat.

My eyes were upon the faithful of the earth, to sit with me:  the
man that walked in the perfect way, he served me.

He that worketh pride shall not dwell in the midst of my house:
he that speaketh unjust things did not prosper before my eyes.

In the morning I put to death all the wicked of the land:  that I
might cut off all the workers of iniquity from the city of the Lord.
